Pong¶

Classic simple game pong firstly appeared in 1972.

class pong.Ball(x: int, y: int, size: int, speed: int, color: tuple)¶

Creates object of class Ball, simple ball with collising with walls and objects of class Player

check_collision(screen_width: int, screen_height: int, players: list[Rect])¶
Method of class Ball wich checks collisions between object of class Ball and walls and objects of class Player
param players:

list of left and right player rects (pygame.Rects)

param screen_width:

width of window with game

param screen_height:

hegiht of window with game

draw(screen: Surface)¶
Method of class Ball which draws object of class Ball on a surface, giving as a parameter
param screen:

surface, where object of class Ball would be drowned

get_rect() → Rect¶
Method of class Ball which returns copy rect (pygame.Rect) of object of class Ball
return:

copy rect (pygame.Rect) of object of class Ball

move()¶

Method of class Ball which moves object of class Ball in a direction, depends on x, y flags

class pong.Counter(x: int, y: int, size: int, count: int, digits: list, left=False, right=False)¶

Creates an object of class Counter. Both sides have counter so wins that side which has more points on counter.

add_score(ball, screen_width: int)¶
Method of class Counter which adds point to the side which scored a goal to another.
param ball:

list or tuple, containing info: [object_x, object_size]

param screen_width:

width of window with game

check_winner() → tuple[bool, bool] | bool¶
Method of class Counter which returns amount od scores
return:

integer equals to amount of scores

draw(screen: Surface)¶
Method of class Counter which draws object of class Counter on a surface, giving as a parameter
param screen:

surface, where object of class Counter would be drowned

get_count() → int¶
Mehtod of class Counter which returns current amount of points
return:

current amount of points

class pong.Game(width: int, height: int, game_FPS: int)¶

Main class. Creates an object of class Game. Contains and proccess all previous classes.

run()¶

Main method of class Game, contains logic, movement and drawing proccesses.

class pong.Player(x: int, y: int, width: int, height: int, speed: int, color: tuple, left=False, right=False)¶

Creates an object of class Player. Players in pong are placed on both sides of the screen and colises with ball and walls.

check_collision(screen_height: int)¶
Method of class Player which checks collisions between object of class Player and walls
param screen_height:

height of window with game

check_events(event: <module 'pygame.event' from 'C:\\Users\\HOME\\PycharmProjects\\Pong\\.venv\\Lib\\site-packages\\pygame\\event.cp312-win_amd64.pyd'>)¶

Method of class Player which checks inpput events (from keyboard) and changes player’s direction the following way: to bottom (S for left player, KEY DOWN for right player) / to top (W for left player, KEY UP for right player) :param event: event (from keyboard) received from method of class Game

draw(screen: Surface)¶
Method of class Player which draws object of class Player on a surface, giving as a parameter
param screen:

surface, where object of class Player would be drowned

get_rect() → Rect¶
Method of class Player which returns copy rect (pygame.Rect) of object of class Player
return:

copy rect (pygame.Rect) of object of class Player

move()¶

Method of class Player which moves object of class Player in to top or to bottom, depends on y flag, aslo oject can stop.

pong.main()¶

Main part of code. Initializates pong.
